website_summaries.verdict: With a lightly-processed recipe made of 70% chicken and other nourishing ingredients like potatoes, cranberries, and pumpkin, your cat will come running for dinner, and you’ll rest easy knowing how healthy it really is.
pros: First ingredients are free-range chicken and eggs
cons: Although this soup-like meal is tasty and healthy, it is definitely on the expensive side

customer_reviews.title: Old/rancid
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOSH _ step away from this food! It is dosed with Potassium Iodide and pushed my cat into Hyperthyroidism in only one short month! It is not their job to medicate your cat. So disappointed trying to find a healthy food for my cat and instead, they've given him a serious health condition. Do not fool around with this!
customer_reviews.author: cs

customer_reviews.title: Has anyone at this company even met a cat?
customer_reviews.text: I tried this for a week despite other reviews. My cats hated it and they're not picky eaters. Side note: who thought it was a great idea to put WHOLE CRANBERRIES and what appears to be a butt ton of parsley in with powdered chicken..? Cats clearly aren't going to eat whole cranberries. I like the concept of human grade cat food but the execution was absolutely terrible. This is disgusting to prepare and I'm certain that my cats don't like it because of the strange texture. It turns into this powdery mush. I'm sure you can develop a human grade paté. I don't understand why the formula had to be so strange and off-putting.
customer_reviews.author: T3iWuth

customer_reviews.title: My cat, stray cat and lcoal wild animals would not eat this
customer_reviews.text: Huge waste of money. My cat will not touch it. The real test was with the stray cat who is not picky at all. She would not eat it either! Finally test was that the racoon, skunk and opossum would not eat it after the stray cat refused it. It sat outside all night with multiple hungry animals and none of them were interested. Complete fail of a product. I tried it since it is human grade and there is no flavor. I could see why the animals would not eat this. Even animals want something that tastes good.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy O

customer_reviews.title: Seriously, what's with the cranberries?
customer_reviews.text: I switched my cat onto this stuff after he had a bout of bladder crystals. He loves his disgusting meat paste, even if the rest of the house is nauseated by the half-appetizing, half-vomit smell and the gross looking crusty bowls that always seem to have an entire cranberry stuck to the bottom. I'd give this 5 stars, but come on, Honest Kitchen, there is no need for whole cranberries in wet cat food. Can't you all grind the damn things up a little better?
customer_reviews.author: sue

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't go near it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried it yesterday and my cat won't go near it....there is no odor that I can pick up on (which is odd) and just looks like moosh. I tried to mix it in several consistencies...none worked. Then I even tried putting a treat on top of it to attract my kitty - who normally is not that picky - it didn't work. Darn. Feels like a complete waste. I'm going to go back to reviews and see if someone posted a trick or how to mix it with something else and report back if something works.
customer_reviews.author: ToughCustomer

customer_reviews.title: My cats wouldn't eat it.
customer_reviews.text: Cats won't eat it. I wish they would, becuase it was one of the top cat food list by truthaboutpetfood.com So I wanted to try it. I did everything I could. Last attempt I even mixed it with warm raw milk. Cats would not touch it. My cats have never been real picky eaters either, but wouldn't try it. I even put a little on my male cat's nose so he would lick it off and he licked it and walked away and Felix is a big eater. So didn't work for our cat family. It has eggs, potatoes, sweet potatoes, cranberries. I don't think a cat in the wild would go for potatoes maybe that's why.
customer_reviews.author: D. L. Dodge

customer_reviews.title: My cat ate this once and threw it up within less than 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 7 year old cat and she seemed eager to eat it. I mixed it up according to directions and feed her a small amount of about a tablespoon and a half. Within 10 minutes she got sick and threw it up all over my living room carpet. She doesn't usually throw up and we have fed her a grain free high quality diet all her life along with the occasional grain free treats and vitamins. We also keep her well brushed. I feel like I wasted a lot of money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Seadollar50

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates it. AGAIN.
customer_reviews.text: I feel like my only bad reviews on Amazon are because my cat tells me to write them on his behalf. This comes as one big giant bag of dry mix (looks like a bag of yellow flour with green specks in it) and you add warm water. I followed instructions, created the green speckled gravy slime and he took two licks and walked away, never to return. I wish they would sell samples instead of making us waste the money. But I don’t blame him. A bag of weird flour that you mix into slime. Not very appetizing.
customer_reviews.author: J in NYC

customer_reviews.title: Turkey formula changed, MFR wouldn't accept Return out $250
customer_reviews.text: Their formula changed and my 19 cats barely ate 10% of it. I asked the manufacturer for a refund and they wouldn't accept the 5 unopened boxes because it was over their 30 day guarantee. It took over 6 weeks to rule out that their food was the one of the two we were using that the cat's didn't like and had allergies to. Several cats stopped eating and lost alot of hair. It cost several visits to the vet for several cats which also costs alot on top of the $250 of product they won't refund. Their answer was short simply saying sorry it's over their guarantee period without addressing their formula change or anything. Worst service ever.
customer_reviews.author: evoefficient1

customer_reviews.title: Cats didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say that my cats hated this food and no matter how hard I tried, wouldn't eat it at all. I like the idea of this food from a couple of perspectives but just could not get any of my three cats to eat it. I tried mixing it with canned food, with dry food, with people food ... begging, pleading ... you name it nothing worked. It did smell good to me when it was mixed but sadly if they won't eat it I can't use it
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ward

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it and it's an affordable alternative
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it doesn't smell great...but it's not your food humans so deal with it! I've been struggling to find an affordable healthy alternative for my cat and this is the one. He doesn't hesitate, howls for it, and has never turned it down. As a struggling young professional I am happy to find something I can afford without compromising my little one's health. Highly recommend! Update: Had to momentarily switch to another food while waiting for my re-order...never again! Kitty's tummy was not thanking me. Thank you for making something so easy on his digestive system. Highly recommend x2!
customer_reviews.author: GStrong

customer_reviews.title: GREAT ingredients; must not taste that good.  :-(
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs eat Honest Kitchen "Force" (turkey) all the time and love it. My cat loves it too, so I decided to buy the "cat" version for him. Unfortunately, he doesn't like it at all, even when I try very small amounts mixed with other food. I feel bad throwing out an almost full 2 lb. box but ... he just doesn't like it. I love this company's philosophy and ingredient list and really hate to submit this review, but like I said ... my cat just won't eat it. Sorry. :-( I WILL continue to buy the dog food though. I gave that 5 stars. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Teech

customer_reviews.title: Best Cat Food Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat food ever. We had no problem getting our cats to like it. They beg for it two times a day. We have one cat who does not even want to wait for it to be made...she eats it dry. Another cat had been losing weight for two years, was sickly, and his his hair was greasy, and matted...after a couple of weeks on Prowl his hair was back to normal and he was gaining weight. We thought we were going to have to have him put down before this food, and now he is back to good health. Our vet was AMAZED!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brent D. Seth

customer_reviews.title: Great cat food
customer_reviews.text: Why is there a flavor option for review? I asked the cat she said it was, I quote “Meow” has anyone else had better results? Chives, scarfs this food down! It leaves her bowl really dirty, and needs to be cleaned almost immediately! I recommend making a couple days worth of food at a time and put it in the refrigerator to make it more solid. ***update*** After a couple of weeks my cat stopped eating this food 😒. We still have well over half the box and after I check that it’s not expired will ask around our community and see if anyone wants to try it with their furry friends.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Kittens don't like it!
customer_reviews.text: We just adopted two kittens and wanted to feed them honest kitchen food. I'd read reviews from others saying that their cats would not eat it, but I figured there wouldn't be a problem with kittens. We tried weaning our new kittens onto this slowly from their old food and they just wouldn't take to it. They'd eat around it and when offered alone they wouldn't touch it. This food sounds great on paper but didn't work for us. You can get samples of the turkey and chickn flavor for one dollar on the honest kitchen website, so I'd definitely recommend trying that before buying a whole box.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Controlled our cat's IBS
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats had pretty severe IBS and had gone from 8 to 6 lbs, even while on the prescription food. After switching her exclusively to this food, for several months, she only ever has issues when she gets into the other cats' food. So we are switching them to this too. Much less vomiting in all of them now, and the IBS cat is very healthy and back to her original weight. They sometimes don't want to eat this, but we just crumble a bit of orijen cat treats on top and they clean it up. One of the cats even eats the whole cranberries that sneak their way into the mix!
customer_reviews.author: Literal Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not for my Ragdoll
customer_reviews.text: The smell was horrible. I tried a small amount first mixed in with my cat's freeze dried food and she would not touch it. Next I tried it by itself dry, she still won't touch it. I tried mixing it with gravy from wet food and she sniffed it and walked away. I tried mixing with warm water and cool water, she again will not touch it.
customer_reviews.author: JeccaLeigh

customer_reviews.title: It took some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: It took my cats a while to get used to this product. I had to mix it with their usual canned food and slowly increase the ratio of grace to canned food. They just looked at the grace suspiciously at first. I thought it smelled so good I wanted to eat it. LOL I believe it is better nutrition for them and they seem to eat less of it to be full than other foods. It is easy to store and prepare as well. I will definitely purchase again. Just be aware you will probably need to introduce your cats to this slowly.
customer_reviews.author: P S.

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: It looks healthy, and my cat has never turned her pretty nose up against any food. But she will have no part of this. I've tried to give her little helpings to get started, but it's still sitting there at the end of every day. Is it returnable? We've used several tablespoons at this point ...
customer_reviews.author: House of Mouse

customer_reviews.title: 3 reasons I love Honest Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This product is different but totally awesome. The process of mixing is super easy w warm water, the cats love it! It did take them a little while to get used to it, but now they crave it and I can alter the amount of water according to the temperature outside. More water in the summer, or when very cold to be proactive for their kidney health! I love Honest Kitchen and it's a great value. Flavor, water intake, value. Honestly!
customer_reviews.author: theworthyhorse

customer_reviews.title: ... 4 stars because my cat is crazy and doesn't like gourmet cat food and prefers the $0
customer_reviews.text: Only 4 stars because my cat is crazy and doesn't like gourmet cat food and prefers the $0.50 cans over this. I got a sample of the dog version in the dog sampler pack Amazon offers for $11.99. My cat has struggled with utis for years and I never see him drink water so this was the only way for me to get water into him. He eats it but complains for hours and has hissy fits about it and runs around the house mad. He'll get used to it because I'm not switching lol. He seems to like the little cranberries in it. Just not the rest of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: No more vomiting! Please REMOVE POTATO
customer_reviews.text: Have been trying to switch my cat from dry kibble to wet. After purchasing many, many, many different and high quality brands to no avail , I gave The Honest Company a try. WOW! What a difference this has made. My only negative thought is about the added potatoes. Those are PURE CARBS and would love to see THE HONEST COMPANY take the potatoes out and add more dehydrated chicken or turkey. Yes, price would be more but willing to go higher.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - if your cat will eat it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this: reduced storage, "fresher", healthier ingredients, etc. However not any of my 4 cats would eat it. Not even TRY it. Smelled and walked away, came back to smell & walk away again. Tried using warm water and letting sit longer than 3 mins to fully reconstitute. Nope. I guess I'll donate the almost full box to an animal shelter. Maybe those cats will be less picky than mine (all of which came from a shelter but are now spoiled, evil monsters).
customer_reviews.author: honeybeebalm

customer_reviews.title: One cat loves it. One cat doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this food. It's easy to mix up, and nice to know I'm giving my cats healthy food. Well, actually only one cat. My Snowshoe little girl, who is obsessed with food (gee. Wonder where she gets that from?), gobbles it up. My dainty little manx girly-girl sniffs at it and runs. One thing I noticed is the occasional whole cranberry in the mix. Have to pick those out.
customer_reviews.author: CJ00579

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This stuff was disgusting to prepare and my cats would not go near it no matter what I tried. What a waste of money. It ended up in the trash. This company would do well to send out small samples or sell smaller amounts for people to try. Would not recommend unless you have a kitten that you can train to eat it, yet even then there is no guarantee they will want it. It literally looks like cat throw up.
customer_reviews.author: L S

customer_reviews.title: Cats Wouldn't Touch This With a 10-Foot Pole!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in a desperate attempt to help my cat who has severe digestive issues. I was encouraged to try it as a result of reading positive reviews. Neither my ill cat nor my other cats would touch this stuff. Expensive lesson learned. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: LMac

customer_reviews.title: Really healthy, just wish my cat liked it.
customer_reviews.text: Of course, I haven't personally tried this product. Perhaps I could have prepared it better. But based on the ingredients and how it's made and what it's made with, this is a pretty awesome product. I rate it 4 stars for that. I just wish they made them in a smaller test size, just so I didn't have to spend so much to be disappointed haha. Oh well (:
customer_reviews.author: Brookfield

customer_reviews.title: Worth to try!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats: one likes only dry kibbles and doesn't want even to try this food. Another one loves it and doesn't want to eat canned food anymore (which is great!). His fur looks better now and he finally started to gain weight a bit. Looks healthier overall. It sucks that some cats are too picky, because product is great.
customer_reviews.author: Zetacat

customer_reviews.title: Cat developed Flutd after this food.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could rate it lower. Firstly getting it to a texture that the cat would eat took quite some time, my cat preffered if it when it was more of a paste than the chunks. Secondly and most importantly my cat developed FLUTD, after trying different vets/hospitals a vet suggested switching his food back. Immediately he started to improve and now is almost back to 100%. Do your research before you buy and if you have a male cat just avoid this altogether. The ingredients in this can cause crystals to develop in the cats urine leading to FLUTD and possible blockage issues. Wish theyd cover my vet bills.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Ward

customer_reviews.title: Let's be "honest" about the size of this product. ...
customer_reviews.text: Let's be "honest" about the size of this product. See photos for serving size, I was disapointed at how little this box serves, this was not the economical alternative to grain free, healthy canned I was looking for. I also found the information misleading on this site as the servings per box were not disclosed anywhere that I could see, except for peoples' vastly varying opinions on how long a box lasts.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Would prefer nuggets over powder
customer_reviews.text: My cat really likes freeze dried food so I thought I would give this a try but unfortunately since it is a powder he is not a fan. He really will not eat freeze dried food if it is wet and since this is a powder he ends up sneezing. Tried coating his regular dry food with it but still won't touch it. Even tried making into "patties" but once it gets wet he just hates it. He likes the smell just not the texture
customer_reviews.author: JJ AZ

customer_reviews.title: Cats are obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: I used to cook for my 7 pets, but when I fell ill with Lyme and had no energy, I started doing this stuff. My cats now refuse home cooked food and screech and bug me until they get their honest kitchen food. I have 6/7 pets on HK food and honestly they couldn’t have better health. No food poisoning from this unlike Freshpet which is a repeat offender or my questionable cooking. 😅
customer_reviews.author: N M

customer_reviews.title: My cats are crazy
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to switch my cats over to really good food but, being crazy, they are not cooperating. They will not eat this food at all. I tried sprinkling just a little bit, like a topper, over their dry food and they just walk away. Stubborn little beasts would rather starve. I think this food looks and smells fabulous but apparently my critters disagree.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn M.

customer_reviews.title: My cats convinced I'm trying to poison them
customer_reviews.text: I have to old, fat and very happy cats who, strangely, will eat just about any cat food. But I wanted to give them something healthier and they tend to barf (high quality) kibble up. They won't touch this stuff and give me the stink eye. No kidding, they just stare at the bowl from afar, won't get close to it.
customer_reviews.author: robert page

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: We've been giving our cats Honest Kitchen "Prowl" chicken-based food for years, and I decided to try the "Grace" turkey-based food this time. They loved it, even the super-finicky little one. And I can see why, this stuff smells delicious. Though they still eat around the cranberries. Some complain that the price is high - I'd rather pay more for food and less in vet bills. Our cats are vibrantly healthy, and I believe it's due in part to the good food they eat.
customer_reviews.author: seashore6Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My picky cat loves Honest Kitchen Cat Food!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked! A friend gave me a box of this cat food. I didn't think my cat would eat it... ever! Was I surprised. Lily, my cat, went for it. Sometimes I add water to make a wet dish, but I always have a bowl of it dry handy for her. She snacks on it throughout the day. I also feed her dry kibble, and cans of wet food. She gets bored when I only feed her one wet food. She likes variety! What can I say?
customer_reviews.author: coo wells

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: The consistency is more like paste rather than a pate once water/broth is added. Personally, my own cats don't care for it. They seemed intrigued by the smell and some of the taste, but they couldn't get past the thick, pasty texture. So issues with the ingredient quality of the food itself, but probably won't be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly all 4 love this food
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats ranging in age from age 2 yrs to 16 years. 2 are very picky about wet food and tend to prefer dry. One eats wet or dry, and 1 of my cats will eat anything. Surprisingly all 4 love this food. They clean their plates as soon as I put it down. I like that I can control the consistency. I must be getting it right because they love it. It’s so nice to have one healthy food that they all enjoy. I never like the smell when opening a can of cat food. This food does not have an obnoxious smell. I’m happy
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Z

customer_reviews.title: None of My 3 Cats would eat this product
customer_reviews.text: The list of ingredients prompted me to buy the product. My three cats vary in appetite from somewhat fussy to "eats anything and everything" but none of them would touch the Honest Kitchen Grain Free Chicken Recipe no matter how much I tried to jazz it up with other cat food and treats. Wound up donating the rather expensive box to an animal shelter.
customer_reviews.author: Marian

customer_reviews.title: Too bad cats hate it
customer_reviews.text: Well, here's a total waste of money. I have 3 cats. Not one of them will touch the stuff. Tried mixing it with their old food (which they love) and it ruins the flavor for them. I've tried it for 2 days. They'd rather starve than eat it. Maybe they should try to make it smell and taste meaty. It smells like grains
customer_reviews.author: Mileseymom

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but cat isn’t crazy about it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done a lot of research on quality cat food, and for the convenience and quality, Honest Kitchen is great! I’ve bought their dog line before and my dog goes crazy for it. Unfortunately my cat is more finicky. He shows more interest in the powder form than after it’s mixed with water. After several tries, my cat accepted it more after it’s mixed with a minimal amount of warm water.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Amount of carbohydrates is dangerous for cats
customer_reviews.text: **Beware** this product is 23.92% carbohydrates, which is not only indigestible for cats but harmful too. Cats simply cannot break down any sort of grains or vegetables. Their bodies metabolize it as glucose, which leads to diseases like diabetes, UTI, kidney failure, and obesity. Cats cannot not be fed like small dogs. Their dietary needs are totally different. Cats need protein and fat, and should not be given any carbohydartes. I want to love this company for it's ethos, but it needs to seriously reformulate it's cat food or just focus on dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberella

customer_reviews.title: The Horde Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to make and becomes less-messy once you get used to it. The kitties love it, but they hate the cranberries, which they spit out onto the floor smh. Also, it's vet recommended for feline diabetes. I will continue to purchase this product, as it is healthier than dry food.
customer_reviews.author: R. Whitted

customer_reviews.title: Tasty kitten mustache
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and our Persian kitty exclusively loves his Honest Kitchen(so does our pup, who gets the doggy version)! We’ve since gotten him more shallow bowls since he’s too grown up & fancy to get his flat face down in it. We feed him kibble liberally and a warm Honest Kitchen dinner. A 2lb box lasts us about 2.5months
customer_reviews.author: V. Keeler

customer_reviews.title: Cat does not recognize it as food.
customer_reviews.text: My cat does not recognize this as food. Going to keep trying. But I don’t have a lot of hope. He will go empty rather then taste it. I put some on his paws to lick off but no dice. However he has always turned up his nose at chicken. I thought it was because of Chinese chix. This is not from China.
customer_reviews.author: Judie Fizer

customer_reviews.title: Snowshoe loves it
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding this to my Snowshoe for about 2 years now, at the recommendation of our vet. I add 1/4 tsp of Honest Kitchen's goat milk probiotic formula, and use warm water. Getting the right consistency is important, it has to be more liquid than paste but there is a point of no return if you add too much liquid (and my cat has no interest then!). He sits next to his food and water mat while I make it for him and eats every bit.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Walker

customer_reviews.title: Adult girl wont touch it / 2 new kittens love it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this food with the idea that i could really water it down as my 11-year-old girl really only wants the "juice" out of cans. Well, she snubbed it completely. I put a dab on her nose, which she cleaned off, but she wont go near the stuff. Our two new little boys (2.5 months) however absolutely love this. I will store it away until they are a little bigger and will be happy when they lick it all up. Only reason for 4 stars is the one I got it for, will not go near it. 2 out of 3 fur-babies isnt a bad thing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jesrache528

customer_reviews.title: My Cats hate this stuff!! Waste of money for me :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cats and both of them really dislike it... won’t eat it even when I mix with their regular food. I added an extra star because service was fine. Another star because My hedgehog really likes it so I’m happy it’s not being wasted.
customer_reviews.author: ASita

customer_reviews.title: Great quality BUT BEWARE, NOT GOOD FOR TEETH
customer_reviews.text: This food is tacky and if not given alternating with dry food it will give your cat a gum infection from the nasty build up on their teeth. ALL MY CATS ENDED WITH SEVERE TEETH/GUM ISSUES so it MUST BE ALTERNATED with a dry food!
customer_reviews.author: Erate

customer_reviews.title: One is a bengal with terrible food allergies
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats. One is a bengal with terrible food allergies. Was worried that cats wouldn't like this in addition to their grain free dry food and that my bengal would be puking and have stomach upset. They all loved this food from the first feeding, and it doesn't seem to upset my sensitive boy. This is a great food. Intend to use this regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: This box lasts about six weeks for my furry little guy. He LOVES this food, and I feel great knowing that he's getting quality ingredients and is also properly hydrated. It smells delicious, to boot! I always joke with my BF that someday I'm going to make a gravy with this cat food. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Laura W

customer_reviews.title: I couldn’t get my cat to eat this food. ...
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t get my cat to eat this food. He is used to crunchy food. I thought he was just being stubborn. Then I read, on one vets website, that some cats aren’t able to recognize soft food as food if they’ve only ever eaten crunchy. That site also went onto say it’s dangerous for a cat to go without eating for more than two days because dangerous to their bodies, some type of toxicity can happen.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T.

customer_reviews.title: Kitties like it. Even our senior super finicky eaters!
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't an immediate gobble down like a can of name brand foods, but it's definitely one they like with gradual transition. Sensitive tummies are doing better with this food as well. The only leftover in any of the bowls is a licked clean cranberry now and then.
customer_reviews.author: ByDezinAZ

customer_reviews.title: Cat's Hated It
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to be a solution to the issue of dealing with canned cat food recalls, and my cat's problems with IBD, etc. None of my cats would eat it--I've got 9, four of them are outdoor barn cats. Nobody. Would. Touch. It. I tried at first mixing it with the canned food they like...nope. Anyway, I hope it works for others.
customer_reviews.author: Lovejoy

customer_reviews.title: Cats want fish not chicken
customer_reviews.text: I love the honest kitchen food I feed it to my dogs however when I tried with my cat he wouldn’t go near this food. He wouldn’t eve grimy it. One smell and he was out of site. I’m kind of sad as this is a really good product. I wonder if I can feed the cat food to my dogs lol
customer_reviews.author: Lisa DeMello

customer_reviews.title: Most economical raw food
customer_reviews.text: My kitten is not at all a picky eater and was raised on raw food (Primal, Stella & Chewy's) so she's used to the soup-y texture. I tried this because the price was easier on me and she loves it. The raw food helps with bathroom smells and I make it on the water-y side to ensure she is getting enough fluids. She gets 1/4 cup in the morning and 1/4 cup in the evening. The 2lb box lasts me ~3 weeks. So, that's about $33 for 4 weeks of food vs competitor prices being about $45 for 4 weeks. If you order the 4lb box then the price is about $30/month at that serving size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: Not what my 12 cats want
customer_reviews.text: I have 12 cats and not one would even try it. I mixed it soupier-still no takers. The first ingredient may be meat but if all the non meat ingredients were added up there may be less meat than vegetables. Cats must have meat and there is too much other stuff in there.
customer_reviews.author: tigergirl

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad to prepare, but cats are cats.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this food so badly. Sadly, even when I disguise it with other meals, the cats turn their nose up at it. Mixed thick or thin, they're not interested. The mice wolfed it down though, so it wasn't a total loss. The ingredients themselves are healthy, but if the cats aren't interested... well, that's their prerogative as felines. :)
customer_reviews.author: SJ and SF

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it but majes for mire food bowl washing
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food and it doesn't take very long to make and lasts for quite a while! Its sort of like flour consistency depending on the amount if water you mix in. I still feed the cats grain free dry cat food sometimes when Im rushing out the door and the cats will always look at me like, where's the other food I like? Only small downside us the cleanup as I have to wash the cat bowls once a week if I want to cheap them clean as the dehydrated cat good will get/stay stuck on the food bowl once it dries out if the cats haven't licked/eaten all of what's in their bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good to mix with!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat used to eat just this, but I guess he got tired of it because at some point he consistently left about 1/3 of it in his bowl. We now mix it with Primal and he devours it. Primal is too expensive for us to give him by itself, so HK and Primal is the compromise. Occasionally we try just the HK and he will not touch it. :/
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great product and  if you take your time and slowly change over their food its worth doing!
customer_reviews.text: Once I was able to slowly change over my cat's food to Honest Kitchen Prowl he loved it. You have to take it slow, only put in a tea spoon to begin with and slowly increase the amount. Make sure to mix well and soften their kibble too. My cat was once over weight but now being put on Honest kitchen grain free diet his weight is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: T. S

customer_reviews.title: My three cats all love this food!
customer_reviews.text: After a few days of my cats turning up their noses at their food I was desperate to find something else for them to eat. I decided to try THK. I just got this in the mail and couldn’t wait until their dinner time to give it a try. I set the box on the counter and my three cats were all rubbing their faces on the box. I hydrated 1/4 cup of food just to give them a taste and I actually had to hold the bowl because all three cats were trying to eat it before it hydrated. Once it was hydrated they scarfed it down!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara P.

customer_reviews.title: Some like it, some don't
customer_reviews.text: My cats and our foster kittens were not interested in eating it... tried in several ways, mixing it in slowly, etc. Gave the box to a friend, her cat loves it. Realize that this food will smell and taste very different from any can food you are feeding, so you may have to work at incorporating it slowly into the diet. Other commentators have mentioned that the food is very carb heavy, which can be a problem if the cat loves it and is already heavy.
customer_reviews.author: BSane

customer_reviews.title: Great, Healthy Product for All Types of Cats!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. Much more convenient to store than cans and allows much more precise portion control. My cat is on a strict caloric intake, but I can mix this up and know exactly what he's eating for each meal! The limited and natural ingredients also help to avoid potential allergens (my cat cant handle some grains). My cat also has urinary crystal issues, but this food has been a great way to increase his water intake and avoid costly prescription food (with much more questionable ingredients) while completely alleviating any symptoms. Some cats take a while to transition to it, but once they are used to it they beg for it!
customer_reviews.author: Andria

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: BEST CATFOOD ON THE PLANET. CURES ACID REFULX. Although at $3.75 per lb, buying raw chicken (drum sticks) at the store will still be cheaper and a great treat to keep your cats diet interesting. Bone and all just give them the drumstick raw and then will strip the bone. Some people feed them just the bones.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: It's a hit!
customer_reviews.text: I just received this in the mail right in time for my cat's dinner. I couldn't be happier with the results! I am no longer going to feed him dry food because of the numerous health risks associated with dry cat food, which is the reason I purchased this dehydrated kitty food. It's healthier for my cat, and all cats really, so I am very excited my cat devoured this food without a second thought. He absolutely loves it and I love knowing it's healthy for him!
customer_reviews.author: Kris3294

customer_reviews.title: Honest Kitchen cat food
customer_reviews.text: Feeding this to a feral that had babies, I brought her inside, she’s just a baby herself. She loves it
customer_reviews.author: Alay53

customer_reviews.title: Formula may be too drying?
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved it the first 2 weeks and then sort of got tired of it. I also noticed after about 3 weeks of using that they were throwing up a lot of hairballs when we've never had that problem when they were on natural balance platefuls... Switched back to natural balance platefuls after using this for about 2-3 months and no more hairballs! Also a weird consistency....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cat food. All natural and smells good enough for a human to eat. But for some reason my cat wouldn’t eat it. I tried for 3 days and she wouldn’t touch it. So disappointed bc it’s so healthy! My cat’s just super finicky. This company was so accommodating and gave me a full refund! I highly recommend tangos food and this company. Thank you Honest Kitchen for your excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but my can't won't eat
customer_reviews.text: I love this company and the concept, but i can't for the life of me get my cat to eat this stuff. It's been two weeks and she's literally starving herself rather than eating it. Otherwise, it reconstitutes well, is easy to make and keeps well in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cook

customer_reviews.title: ... loves this food and i can tell she feels better on it
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food and i can tell she feels better on it. She also had a an allergy to something in her previous food and after switching to THK her skin has cleared up and her coat has grown in thicker and softer. She sits by her bowl waiting for this food...you should hear that enthusuastic meow when she sees the bowl being put down with her rehydrated food. And that purring sound when shes done eating. Very happy kitty.
customer_reviews.author: Mel07

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Won't Eat It
customer_reviews.text: I am all in favor of the ingredients and believe this to be good quality but neither of my cats will touch it, and I've tried numerous times. I don't know if it's the flavor or the consistency they don't like, but the box was expensive so it's disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon K

customer_reviews.title: IT IS WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I ordered this for my fur babies! It took them a bit to get used to it, and they still prefer a little bit of their old (unhealthy!) canned food mixed in, but since they've switched to The Honest Kitchen, I can SEE & FEEL a positive difference in them! They aren't as lethargic (indoor cats!), their coats are shinier, and their moods have even improved! It is WORTH IT to feed your furry family the right stuff! You wouldn't want to eat McDonald's every day of your life, would you? That's basically our equivalent of all the chain-store crap they sell us for our animals!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Lee

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old (17+) Cornish Rex and she cleans up every bit out of her bowl. There is NO waste as compared to canned food and her appearance has gotten better. I'd recommend this cat food to anyone and have purchased a second box.
customer_reviews.author: Black Kate

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should try this out on their furry friends
customer_reviews.text: Better than Kibble.. Better than Canned Food.. Doesn't smell terrible like most Canned Food.. Prep time doesn't take too long, couple minutes.. You can create whatever serving sizes you want.. My only complaint is the cranberries could be chopped up a little smaller. Try it out! Unless you're super lazy..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bates

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love this!
customer_reviews.text: This food is really great for our cats. They all love it and we've been able to use it for over a year at this point. It makes it really easy to control their weight and it's also way less expensive and wasteful than buying canned food--no cans to get rid of every day!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for my fussy cat
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea, but my cat wouldn't touch it. I tried adding a little to her existing food, wouldn't eat it. I tried mixing it with chicken broth, wouldn't touch it. I'm sure it would be great for her, but if she won't eat it, it's just a big waste of money. A smaller sample size would have helped me save a lotta money. I guess I'll donate it to a rescue.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Reed

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve got sampler
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for the dogs(2)and one for my cats(3) but none of the cats liked it and only one dog likes it how is that possible if that’s supposed to be good for them want to know how to get them to eat it because what am I suppose to do with two boxes of no guarantee I should’ve just got sampler first
customer_reviews.author: Paula Candeias

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky felines!
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it and it's a great food! I work for a vet and recommend this to clients with picky eaters or stomach sensitivities not related to medical conditions. My cats love this and I use it to mix in with kibble to spice it up.
customer_reviews.author: ChiliRae

customer_reviews.title: Great Healthy Pet Food
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old cat has been eating Honest Kitchen cat food for quite a few years. He is still very active and healthy (brought us a lovely rat the other day), which I think is mostly due to the quality food he eats. He loves the taste too. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TWinSD

customer_reviews.title: Cats won't eat it
customer_reviews.text: This food seems very healthy but unfortunately none of my cats will touch it, not even the one who eats everything.
customer_reviews.author: Rapunzel

customer_reviews.title: Cured my cat's idiopathic hypercalcemia
customer_reviews.text: The vet said our cat would have to be on steroids her entire life. Well, eventually the steroids were causing her to lose her fur and her ears started to droop, so I searched for other options. I read several studies regarding food additives and idiopathic hypercalcemia and decided to try Honest Kitchen. While feeding her this food, we slowly weaned her off the prednisolone. It worked! Her calcium levels are normal and she is back to her healthy self! I wish I had before and after pictures for you. Her fur grew back and she now has a luxurious coat, in addition to becoming playful and happy again. This is a great food! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: J. Michael Solberg

customer_reviews.title: Best petfood we have ever tried
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best pet food we have ever tried. Our cat loves it and it's good for him. It's easy to make and smells fantastic even to me. The only down side is that it is expensive, but you get what you pay for. I know that the ingredients in this food are perfect for my cat and that there are no fillers or additives that I don't want him getting. The company's website has a great feature to help you pick the right food for your pet also. Can't go wrong with this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had to put one of my cats on a higher protein diet to lose a few lbs, but my other cat is extremely picky and will throw fits when he is given a high protein kibble that he doesn't like. This stuff has helped immensely! It mixes up like a pate, and he goes nuts for it! My diet restricted cat loves it too, but she (obviously) is much less picky. I usually give them a serving of the dry kibble in the morning and a serving of this at night to help it last, and they're both very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Levi approved
customer_reviews.text: This is levi. I have been storing this food on top of the fridge. He loves it. Well today he found its location. As you can see he couldn’t wait for help! I figured it was safe there in a cardboard box... won’t make that mistake again! He would give it ten stars!
customer_reviews.author: Ok k girl

customer_reviews.title: This stuff sure is handy.
customer_reviews.text: I got a sample of this stuff when I went to pet store. My cats liked it and now I keep in on hand as a way to provide variety to their diets. Also, it is a back up for when I run low on kibble . It is a lot cheaper than canned food and still seems to be healthy. I just wish I could buy a little less at a time because it still is more expensive than the dry foods.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: No luck for us :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this food. Praying my cat would be as excited about it as I was..Seems like a quality product.. but my cat won't go near it. I've tried several different times with different amounts of water for food consistency.. but no dice! It does have a weird smell/look, so I dont really blame her. She is a Bengal, and quite picky.. so I'm not sure if that is a qualified reason for not eating it. :( sad panda other way. Hoping I can get a refund /return the product .
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: My Cats won’t touch it
customer_reviews.text: I had a high hopes for this cat food. I was very much wanting to feed better quality of cat food to my two cats. One of my cats will eat just about anything the other one is very picky. Neither of my cats would go anywhere near this food. Unfortunately this is been an expensive boondoggle.
customer_reviews.author: ddm45

customer_reviews.title: Came as advertised but..
customer_reviews.text: My tiny cat doesn't seem to like it. I can't give a product lowered stars because my cat avoids it. Based on what is advertised, it did what it was supposed to. Going from store bought, dry cat food I suppose this would be like giving a kid fast food all the time then one day switching to only healthy foods like a bowl of Brussel Sprouts. I will donate it and try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Unsaintly

customer_reviews.title: My cat refuses to eat it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cat food because it was recommended for having pure ingredients. I have no issue with the ingredients. My cat won't go near this food. I've tried mixing it 50/50 with her other food. She refuses to eat it. $25 is a lot of money to pay for cat food that your cat refuses to eat. Apparently, I can't return it. So I'm tossing it. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Wegner

customer_reviews.title: My cat
customer_reviews.text: Spike is in kidney failure and this is the best food to give him. You wouldn't even know he is sick and I have to push him out of the way while I am making his food. He loves it. I also mix this with the greens for my dogs (3) every night and they love it too.
customer_reviews.author: tullady

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it; not me so much...
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food, but investigation of optimal nutrient levels indicate that this is rather low in protein and high in fat. I would rather pay a few dollars more and replace some potato with more chicken or turkey and also have it be lower calorie/cup.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - Not one kitty would eat it.
customer_reviews.text: Not one of six (6) cats would eat it. In fact, my cousin’s two cats wouldn’t eat it either (although I did not personally see his two reject it). Very disappointing, as the ingredients appear to be top-notch. Was the problem the parsley, perhaps..? Not sure, just a guess. It certainly has a strong aroma. I tried mixing other food with it to tone it down, both wet and another time dry. Two did take a bite but that was it. It wasn’t cheap, so I threw away $$$. I waited too long to request a return, my loss. I gave two stars instead of one for the quality level.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Love this product.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. So many great things to say! Wonderful quality food that my pets love. It works very well in a multi-cat household. Easy to portion for weight control and has alleviated several issues such as dander and GI problems.I have tried several kinds of the Honest Kitchen's line and I'd recommend them all. They are very pricey, but it offsets the vet costs now that they are healthy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 15 YO cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 yo cat loves this! She gets excited every morning when she hears me making it. I mix a heaping tablespoon full with enough water to make more of a gravy as a supplement to her dry food. The cranberries are too hard but there are not many. I was worried that it would give her the poops but it didn't. Regular canned food upsets her system. She also gets greenies for her teeth. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Koerperich

customer_reviews.title: My cats won't eat it.
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by a friend who has five cats who love it. Mine are very intrigued by the smell, but won't eat it. I like it better than wet food, but it is of no use if my cats won't eat it. One of my cats is finicky, but the other eats most foods and even he didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: CEF

customer_reviews.title: High quality and cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: It took my cats a few days to get into this but now they love it! I switch it up with hard food. But I love the high quality ingredients of this more than any other food!
customer_reviews.author: MountainMama

customer_reviews.title: It is annoying! The company should grind cranberries and hard-chicken-pieces
customer_reviews.text: My 3 picky-eaters do not mind having this every other day with "INSTANT GOAT'S MILK PLUS PROBIOTICS." Please grind cranberries and hard-chicken-pieces. (Soaking them for 3-10 minutes doesn't make them soft. They (cranberries and hard-chicken-pieces) come out as they go in when I check my babies' daily business.) My babies try to leave most of hard-chicken-pieces and whole-cranberries in the dish unless I grind them. It is annoying! The company should grind cranberries and hard-chicken-pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Give your kitty a little time to get used to this
customer_reviews.text: At first Galina did not get excited about Prowl. She sat near it, stretched out, looked at it for a while... then walked away, meowing her dissatisfaction. Most canned cat foods she pounces on. So I began mixing it with her regular canned food, and now she is very happy with it. She used to have a problem with throwing up a lot, but not when I giver her Prowl! It is a little messy and requires a bit more effort to make and clean up after. But I like the idea and the ethics - freerange chicken, no by-products and suspicious fillers, and no cans. I just ordered some more.
customer_reviews.author: T. Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Our 3 cats try to bury this food lol
customer_reviews.text: This is great quality food. Our dogs love the dog version, but none of our 3 cats will eat this. They sniff it, then immediately try to bury it. I've tried every consistency and last time even subbed the water for chicken broth, but they still sniff and try to bury. I really wanted to love this food, expensive though it is, but the cats say no, no, no.
customer_reviews.author: Cindi Clinton

product_meta.title: The Honest Kitchen Human Grade Dehydrated Grain Free Cat Food
product_meta.description:
Style:Free Range Chicken| Size:4 lb (makes 12 lbs)

ABOUT PROWL DEHYDRATED CAT FOOD:

Dished up with 70% free-range chicken, Prowl is the original cat’s meow for adult and senior kitties, who don’t dig grains. It’s a less processed, high moisture alternative to canned food, and it’s bursting with natural whole food goodness.

The Honest Kitchen Prowl is a dehydrated cat food that is AAFCO complete and balanced for adult cats of all breeds. This dehydrated cat food is high in moisture and can be used in place of homemade or canned cat food diets.

This cat food is 100% human-grade cat food (an important quality distinction!) and contains no red flag pet food ingredients like corn, soy, rice, beet pulp or wheat. Just add warm water, wait 3 minutes and serve a delicious & healthy meal!

ABOUT THE HONEST KITCHEN:

The Honest Kitchen started in Lucy Postin’s kitchen in 2002 when she started making her dog’s meals from scratch to help combat his ear infections. The physical difference from his new diet was spectacular but her kitchen was a mess.

Lucy then realized that dehydrating whole foods made mealtimes much simpler while maintaining the natural health benefits of the ingredients. From there, The Honest Kitchen was born - and her kitchen stayed much cleaner!

Today, The Honest Kitchen is on a mission to revolutionize the pet food industry through their obsession with product integrity and commitment to help as many pets as possible get on the road to good health through natural, wholesome proper food.

Feeding Instructions

Weight Daily Feeding (cup) 1 - 5 lbs 1/8 - 1/4 6 - 10 lbs 1/4 - 1/2 11 - 16 lbs 1/2 - 3/4 17 - 21 lbs 3/4 - 1 Mix food with warm water, stir well and wait 3 minutes for food to hydrate. These guidelines are based on the requirements of lean and more active, indoor/outdoor cats. For less active cats, we recommend feeding slightly less. For larger cats, adjust accordingly. Our foods must be hydrated with water before serving, but you can add slightly more or less water than we suggest, according to your pet's taste. Refrigerate or discard any leftovers.

Transition Instructions If your dog has never tried our foods before, we recommend starting out slowly. Over a period of 1 to 2 weeks or so, start by adding just a small amount of the Honest Kitchen (with water added) into your dog’s current meals. Gradually increase the amount of the Honest Kitchen while decreasing the amount of your dog’s original diet.

The Honest Kitchen may be mixed in with your dog’s current dry kibble, canned, raw, etc. However, we do not suggest adding in other extra ingredients during the transition if you can avoid it, especially if your pup’s system is very sensitive. After you’ve successfully transitioned your dog to the new food, perhaps after 2-4 weeks or so, and they are doing well, then you may consider adding in extra ingredients or introducing another honest kitchen recipe, etc.
feature_bullets: GRAIN FREE: This healthy cat food is made with free-range chicken and dehydrated for easier digestibility and to lock in nutrients.
HIGH PROTEIN: Packed with protein and high in moisture, this cat food is the perfect less processed alternative to canned food.
HUMAN GRADE: The Honest Kitchen meets the rigorous FDA safety standards to use the label 'human grade', ensuring the highest quality cat food.
ALL NATURAL: This wholesome cat food is made with no by-products, preservatives or GMO ingredients - just add water for a warm, delicious meal.
MADE IN THE USA: All ingredients are processed in the USA in a human grade food processing facility with nothing from China.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
